FDG.function_description: The current page (a travel service entry page for domestic/outbound tours) displays a location - based prompt dialog, asking the user whether to switch to view travel - related services and information under the city of Mountain View (where the user is currently located).

Click the cancel button on page 34

Click the back arrow icon on page 37 to navigate back to page 39.

Wait, but the functional point is the personal center, so the entry is page 39? Or the action is navigating to the personal center via back arrow from order page. So the steps: S1: On page 38 (全部订单), click the back arrow (action_ref [38,0]) to go to page 39 (个人中心). Then, on page 39, the personal center functions are available. But since there's only one action, the logic is: The user navigates from the '全部订单' page (page 38) to the personal center page (page 39) by clicking the back arrow. Once on the personal center page, they can manage orders, view membership benefits, use credit services, manage personal information, or browse recommendations. Since there's only one action, no branches. So:
